snippet: Volatility eased as investors appeared to take in stride the latest developments in the European debt crisis and persistent worries about economic growth.
abstract: Investors seem to have taken in stride the latest developments in the European debt crisis and persistent worries about economic growth, easing volatility with January ending a relatively stable month on Wall Street; stocks made slow but steady advances, with their biggest January gain since 1997; some analysts predict a pullback in the short term, with uneven trading ahead.
lead_paragraph: Volatility eased as investors appeared to take in stride the latest developments in the European debt crisis and persistent worries about economic growth.

headline.seo: In January, a Rare Calm Fell on the Markets
headline.main: In January, a Calm Fell on the Markets
headline.print_headline: In January, A Calm Fell On Markets
